intro: Berkheya chamaepeuce, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are erect and often branched. Berkheya chamaepeuce is adapted to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
